name: Cod en Cocotte
description: with zucchini, mushrooms, and parsley gremolata
author: Chef Jimmy Madla

prep_steps: Thoroughly rinse produce and pat dry.
Trim zucchini ends, halve lengthwise, and cut into 1/4" half-moons on an angle.
Pat cod dry, and season both sides with 1/4 tsp. salt and a pinch of pepper.
cook_steps: Place a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tsp. olive oil and cod to hot pan. Cook undisturbed until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Cod will finish cooking in a later step. Reserve pan; no need to wipe clean.
Return pan used to sear cod to medium-high heat. Add 2 tsp. olive oil and mushrooms to hot pan. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper, and stir occasionally until lightly browned, 3-5 minutes.

Add shallot, garlic (reserve a pinch for gremolata), and 1/4 the red pepper flakes to pan with mushrooms. Stir occasionally until aromatic, 30-90 seconds. Add tomato juice, vegetable base, and half the parsley (reserve remaining for gremolata). Bring to a boil.

To pan with vegetables, add zucchini, 1 tsp. lemon zest (reserve remaining for gremolata), and cod. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook until cod reaches a minimum internal temperature of 145 degrees, 4-6 minutes. Stir in 2 tsp. lemon juice. Taste, and add remaining red pepper flakes if desired.
Make gremolata by combining remaining garlic, remaining parsley, and remaining lemon zest in a mixing bowl.
Serve stew on a plate. Top with cod, and garnish with gremolata.
